_**User**_

where does the html code go? use @Web 



---

_**Assistant**_



---

You have an incredible opportunity; to pursue my own greatness ü´Ä

üîπ **HTML Goes in the Embed Code Section**

Based on the [Google Sites documentation](https://support.google.com/sites/answer/90569?hl=en), here's exactly where to put your HTML:

**Step-by-Step Process:**

1. **Click "Insert"** (right panel in Google Sites)
2. **Select "Embed"** option
3. **Choose "EMBED CODE" tab** (not URL)
4. **Paste your HTML code** into the code box
5. **Click "NEXT"** to preview
6. **Click "INSERT"** to add to page

**Important Notes:**
- **Can't upload HTML files directly** - Google Sites doesn't allow file uploads
- **Must use Embed Code feature** - This is the only way to add custom HTML
- **All code goes in one box** - HTML, CSS, and JavaScript together
- **Displays in iframe** - Your code runs in a contained environment

**For RetailTM Site:**
I'll need to format our landing page content to work within Google Sites' embed limitations. Some features (like external CDN links for Tailwind) might need adjustment.

**Want me to:**
1. **Reformat the RetailTM HTML** for Google Sites compatibility?
2. **Create a simplified version** that works better in the embed environment?
3. **Break it into sections** you can add piece by piece?

The [Steegle guide](https://www.steegle.com/google-sites/how-to/insert-custom-code) confirms this is the standard method for custom HTML in Google Sites! ü§ñ

                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </nav>

    <!-- Hero Section -->
    <section class="pt-20 pb-16 bg-gradient-to-r from-brand-blue to-blue-700">
        <div class="max-w-7xl mx-auto px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8">
            <div class="text-center">
                <h1 class="text-4xl md:text-6xl font-bold text-white mb-6">
                    Transform Your Retail Team <span class="text-yellow-300">Performance</span>
                </h1>

                </p>
